intro: Senefeldera, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It comprises several species, most of which are native to the Americas, particularly South America. These plants are typically herbaceous perennials with showy yellow or orange composite flowers. Senefeldera species often grow in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Their botanical features include alternate leaves and a characteristic daisy-like inflorescence.
